required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating The Efficacy Of A Novel Ibuprofen Formulation On Fever In Patients With An Uncomplicated Acute Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation Of The Antipyretic Efficacy Of Ibuprofen Sodium Tablets In Subjects With An Uncomplicated Acute Infection

brief_summary.textblock: This single-dose trial will evaluate the efficacy of a novel ibuprofen formulation compared to placebo in patients with a fever due to an uncomplicated acute infection.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Time-weighted Sum of The Temperature Differences From Baseline Through Hour 6 (STEMPD 0-6)
primary_outcome.description: STEMPD 0-6 was defined as time-weighted sum of temperature differences over 6 hours, weighted by the time elapsed between each 2 consecutive time points. Temperature difference was defined as baseline temperature minus post-baseline temperature at each time point, where positive value indicated improvement in body temperature.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time-weighted Sum of The Temperature Differences From Baseline Through Hour 4 and Hour 8 (STEMPD 0-4 and STEMPD 0-8)
secondary_outcome.description: STEMPD 0-4 and STEMPD 0-8 were defined as the time-weighted sum of temperature differences over 4 hours and 8 hours, weighted by the time elapsed between each 2 consecutive time points. Temperature difference was defined as baseline temperature minus post-baseline temperature at each time point, where positive value indicated improvement in body temperature.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Temperature at Hours 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6 and 8
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in temperature was calculated as baseline temperature minus post-baseline temperature at each time point, where positive value indicated improvement in body temperature.
Median time of dropping out of the participants from the study due to lack of efficacy or use of rescue medication, whichever comes first.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative Percentage of Participants With Treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who withdrew from the study due to lack of efficacy or received rescue medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Assessment of Study Medication as an Antipyretic
secondary_outcome.description: Global assessment of study medication was performed at the 8-hours time point or immediately before taking rescue medication (if necessary). It was scored on a 5-point categorical scale where 0=poor, 1=fair, 2=good, 3=very good, and 4=excellent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rating of Study Medication Relative to Usual Medication
secondary_outcome.description: Rating of study medication was performed at the 8-hours time point or immediately before taking rescue medication (if necessary). It was scored on a 5-point categorical scale where 0=poor, 1=fair, 2=good, 3=very good, and 4=excellent.

intervention.description: Single dose of a novel ibuprofen formulation (equal to 400mg ibuprofen)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects diagnosed with a fever secondary to an uncomplicated acute viral or bacterial infection.
- Oral temperature measurement from 100 to 104 degrees Fahrenheit.
- Onset of fever 3 days or less.
- Otherwise good health.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Fever secondary to a chronic underlying medical condition or serious infection.
- Currently taking antibiotics or antivirals.
- Currently taking any medication which may interfere with the assessment of fever.
- Pregnancy or breast-feeding.
- Any serious medical or psychiatric disorder.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Single oral dose of 2 placebo tablets matched to ibuprofen sodium 256 milligram (mg) tablet.

group.title: Ibuprofen Sodium
group.description: Single oral dose of 2 ibuprofen sodium 256 mg tablets, equivalent to 400 mg ibuprofen.

group.description: Single oral dose of 2 placebo tablets matched to ibuprofen sodium 256 mg tablet.

group.title: Ibuprofen Sodium
group.description: Single oral dose of 2 ibuprofen sodium 256 mg tablets, equivalent to 400 mg ibuprofen.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Time-weighted Sum of The Temperature Differences From Baseline Through Hour 6 (STEMPD 0-6)
outcome.description: STEMPD 0-6 was defined as time-weighted sum of temperature differences over 6 hours, weighted by the time elapsed between each 2 consecutive time points. Temperature difference was defined as baseline temperature minus post-baseline temperature at each time point, where positive value indicated improvement in body temperature.
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants who received study medication and provided a baseline temperature assessment.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Single oral dose of 2 placebo tablets matched to ibuprofen sodium 256 mg tablet.

group.title: Ibuprofen Sodium
group.description: Single oral dose of 2 ibuprofen sodium 256 mg tablets, equivalent to 400 mg ibuprofen.

measure.title: Time-weighted Sum of The Temperature Differences From Baseline Through Hour 6 (STEMPD 0-6)
measure.description: STEMPD 0-6 was defined as time-weighted sum of temperature differences over 6 hours, weighted by the time elapsed between each 2 consecutive time points. Temperature difference was defined as baseline temperature minus post-baseline temperature at each time point, where positive value indicated improvement in body temperature.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all randomized participants who received study medication and provided a baseline temperature assessment.

analysis.groups_desc: Treatment difference (Ibuprofen sodium-Placebo) and corresponding 95 percent (%) confidence interval (CI) were calculated based on Least-squares (LS) means from the Analysis of Variance (ANOVA) model.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value was calculated using ANOVA model with treatment and baseline temperature terms. Statistical testing was done at 5% significance level (2-sided).

outcome.title: Time-weighted Sum of The Temperature Differences From Baseline Through Hour 4 and Hour 8 (STEMPD 0-4 and STEMPD 0-8)
outcome.description: STEMPD 0-4 and STEMPD 0-8 were defined as the time-weighted sum of temperature differences over 4 hours and 8 hours, weighted by the time elapsed between each 2 consecutive time points. Temperature difference was defined as baseline temperature minus post-baseline temperature at each time point, where positive value indicated improvement in body temperature.
outcome.population: ITT population included all randomized participants who received study medication and provided a baseline temperature assessment.

outcome.title: Time to Treatment Failure
outcome.description: Median time of dropping out of the participants from the study due to lack of efficacy or use of rescue medication, whichever comes first.
outcome.population: ITT population included all randomized participants who received study medication and provided a baseline temperature assessment.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Single oral dose of 2 placebo tablets matched to ibuprofen sodium 256 mg tablet.

group.title: Ibuprofen Sodium
group.description: Single oral dose of 2 ibuprofen sodium 256 mg tablets, equivalent to 400 mg ibuprofen.

measure.title: Time to Treatment Failure
measure.description: Median time of dropping out of the participants from the study due to lack of efficacy or use of rescue medication, whichever comes first.
measure.population: ITT population included all randomized participants who received study medication and provided a baseline temperature assessment.

measurement_list.measurement: Data was not summarized, as median time to treatment failure for placebo group was greater than 8 hours (study duration) therefore 95% CI was not estimable.
Data was not summarized, as median time to treatment failure for ibuprofen sodium group was greater than 8 hours (study duration) therefore 95% CI was not estimable.

outcome.title: Cumulative Percentage of Participants With Treatment Failure
outcome.description: Percentage of participants who withdrew from the study due to lack of efficacy or received rescue medication.
outcome.population: ITT population included all randomized participants who received study medication and provided a baseline temperature assessment.

measure.title: Cumulative Percentage of Participants With Treatment Failure

measure.population: ITT population included all randomized participants who received study medication and provided a baseline temperature assessment.

analysis.groups_desc: 8 hours: Treatment difference (Ibuprofen sodium-Placebo) and its associated CI were calculated based on Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel (CMH) adjusted proportion and the corresponding standard errors.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value was calculated using CMH general association test using table scores. Statistical testing was done at 5% significance level (2-sided).

outcome.title: Global Assessment of Study Medication as an Antipyretic
outcome.description: Global assessment of study medication was performed at the 8-hours time point or immediately before taking rescue medication (if necessary). It was scored on a 5-point categorical scale where 0=poor, 1=fair, 2=good, 3=very good, and 4=excellent.
outcome.population: ITT population included all randomized participants who received study medication and provided a baseline temperature assessment.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Single oral dose of 2 placebo tablets matched to ibuprofen sodium 256 mg tablet.

group.title: Ibuprofen Sodium
group.description: Single oral dose of 2 ibuprofen sodium 256 mg tablets, equivalent to 400 mg ibuprofen.

measure.title: Global Assessment of Study Medication as an Antipyretic
measure.description: Global assessment of study medication was performed at the 8-hours time point or immediately before taking rescue medication (if necessary). It was scored on a 5-point categorical scale where 0=poor, 1=fair, 2=good, 3=very good, and 4=excellent.
measure.population: ITT population included all randomized participants who received study medication and provided a baseline temperature assessment.

analysis.groups_desc: Treatment difference (Ibuprofen sodium-Placebo) and the associated CI were calculated based on the weighted Gamma statistic.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value was calculated using CMH test with modified ridit scores. Statistical testing was done at 5% significance level (2-sided).

outcome.title: Rating of Study Medication Relative to Usual Medication
outcome.description: Rating of study medication was performed at the 8-hours time point or immediately before taking rescue medication (if necessary). It was scored on a 5-point categorical scale where 0=poor, 1=fair, 2=good, 3=very good, and 4=excellent.
outcome.population: ITT population included all randomized participants who received study medication and provided a baseline temperature assessment.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Definitive conclusion could not be made due to early termination of study, due to low enrollment rate, and small number of enrolled participants.
